item.title: Counter-Strike 2 Just Broke The All-Time High Player Peak Record Yet Again
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/counter-strike-2-record-broke-again/

Counter-Strike 2 keeps breaking the all-time high record for peak concurrent players on Steam. It seems as though a new record is being set every week at this point, and the latest figure is a doozy. Hours ago, the game hit 1.82 million peak players, which represents solid growth since the last time the record was broken with 1.74 million peak players.

As I write this, 1.5 million people around the world are playing Counter-Strike 2. The next top title on Steam is PUBG, the free-to-play battle royale game, which has 659,000 people playing.

Nothing comes close to Counter-Strike 2.

Here We Are Again

Counter-Strike 2 has secured another peak player record, and at this point, it’s becoming at least a monthly affair. More people are playing Counter-Strike than ever before, and it never leaves the top spot on Steam unless something remarkable hits the market, like Palworld.

It doesn’t end there, though.

Counter-Strike 2 is also the most popular game on Twitch by a mile, boasting 381,000 concurrent viewers at the time of writing. In second place is Just Chatting, with 316,000 viewers – the next top game on Twitch is Dota 2, with 183,000 viewers.

It helps that Counter-Strike 2 has a phenomenally popular esports scene, and that’s where much of the viewership and player count records come from. Most of the top channels on Twitch broadcasting Counter-Strike 2 are co-streaming the ESL Pro League, which is unfolding as you read this.

Whenever a top-tier esports tournament unravels in the Counter-Strike 2 space, it makes people flood the game, all eager to replicate what they’ve seen the best Counter-Strike players do on stream.

When did you last play Counter-Strike 2? Perhaps you’re playing it right now, loading into a match as you read this. Let me know in the comments.

item.title: OpTic Texas Hits 0-18 Map Streak as Kenny Lands Lowest KD in COD Esports History
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/optic-texas-map-streak-kenny-lowest-kd/

Last night, OpTic Gaming’s Hector ‘HECZ’ Rodriguez published a lengthy video exploring the ‘curse’ that lingers over OpTic Texas in the Call of Duty League. Hours later, the team suffered another loss, hitting a map record of 0-18, which is one of the worst records in the history of Call of Duty esports.

Not only that, but in the series against the LA Theives, the most dominant team in the CDL right now, OpTic’s Kenny secured the lowest KD in competitive COD history. Curse or not, something has to change for OpTic Texas, which is on an unrivalled bad luck run.

Top to Bottom

Last year, OpTic Texas claimed the Call of Duty League Championship, the most prestigious award in the ecosystem. The team netted the first world title for OpTic in Call of Duty in several years, and everyone lauded this incredibly talented team.

Fast forward to today, and the fans are rebelling against the same roster, which has put up one of the worst records in competitive history. In the last batch of matches played, OpTic Texas has gone 0-18, failing to secure a single map in six fixtures.

It was noticed shortly after the recent match finished that Kenny had dropped a 0.3 KD ratio, which is, according to statistics aggregation platforms, the lowest kill-death ratio in Call of Duty esports history. That’s a record set by a two-time world champion, which just seems bizarre at this point.

In the round of Hardpoint against LA Thieves, Kenny set a woeful record, pulling just 11 kills in what was a complete thrashing from the Thieves.

In the recent video published by HECZ, the OpTic Texas team was all smiles as they pondered what could be wrong, with the entire office believing that a curse was upon the squad. Fans worldwide are pleading for a change, but nobody has a solid grip on what needs to be altered to get OpTic Texas winning maps.

What’s worse is that in just a few days, Major II will unravel in Texas, backed by OpTic. The team will start in the worst position at its home event and will have just one chance to stay in the running.

What do you think needs to change at OpTic Texas?

item.title: Bit Reactor & Respawn Entertainment Will Reveal Their Star Wars Game in April
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/star-wars-bit-reactor/

Bit Reactor and Respawn Entertainment have officially announced that they will be revealing their Star Wars turn-based tactics game in April 2025.

The announcement came courtesy of the official Star Wars website, where is was officially announced that the announcement will come as a part of the Star Wars Celebration Japan, which starts on April 18, 2025.

As mentioned, the game will be revealed live on the ‘Galaxy Stage’ on April 19. “Join Bit Reactor, along with Respawn Entertainment and Lucasfilm Games, for a first look at a new Star Wars turn-based tactics game,” the announcement reads.

The officially announcement comes following a leak in January 2025, which said that Bit Reactor and Respawn Entertaining were gearing up for an announcement at Star Wars Celebration Japan.

Announced in January 2022, Respawn Entertainment’s Star Wars RTS is being developed alongside Bit Reactor, led by games industry veteran Greg Foerstch. Respawn will produce the new Star Wars strategy game, while Bit Reactor will lead the development of the title. 

“We are huge fans of Star Wars here at Respawn and we’re thrilled to work with Lucasfilm Games on new titles that we have wanted to make for years,” said Zampella. “If you want to make great Star Wars games, you should come join us on our journey.”
